page.title: 04Changes in Land Use
page.content: In the 195O's a new estate was built around Park Road and farmland was also taken over by the present fire station and ambulance station. In the 196O's Anchor Square was demolished, together with the Red Cross house and the railway station. In their places new flats and small nursery factories have been erected. A new doctor's surgery was built in Butts Road, as well as a new housing development on Ashford Road. Lady Manners School was built in 1936 on the site of former farmland, and extensions were added during the 197O's. As in all towns, recreation plays an important part in Bakewell. Bath Gardens, with its bowling green, and Scott's Meadow were given to the town and converted into a recreation areas.
